Jack Coen
Recruitment Consultant at Harnham
THE COMPANYCOMPANY: A growing startup building the future of autonomous heavy equipment TEAM: Manage a team of autonomy researcher and engineers CULTURE: Casual work environment along with a diverse and inclusive culture; flexible working hours and a work-from-home policy.THE ROLEAs a Director of Autonomy you will…Lead the development of autonomous systems for heavy equipment, including perception, planning, control, and safetyDevelop and maintain relationships with internal and external stakeholders, including customers, partners, and regulatory agenciesDevelop and implement a roadmap for autonomous technology, including short-term and long-term goalsManage a team of autonomy engineers and researchers, providing guidance, mentorship, and technical oversight to ensure that team members are meeting performance expectations and delivering high-quality workStay up-to-date with the latest autonomous technology research and trends, identifying opportunities to incorporate these into our products and servicesCollaborate with cross-functional teams to integrate autonomous technology into our product offeringsYOUR SKILLS AND EXPERIENCEPh.D. or Master's degree in Computer Science, Robotics, or related fieldAt least 10 years of experience in autonomous systems, including algorithm development, software engineering, and safety-critical systemsDemonstrated experience leading and managing teams of autonomy engineers and researchersStrong technical knowledge of autonomous technology, including perception, planning, control, and safetyExperience in developing software for robotics platforms, including ROS and/or other middlewareExperience in safety-critical systems and safety certification processes, such as ISO 26262 or similar standardsExcellent communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work across functional teams to drive projects forwardStrong problem-solving and analytical skills, with the ability to identify and solve complex technical challengesExperience in product management or product development is a plusTHE BENEFITSAs a Machine Learning Engineer, you can expect a base salary between $220,000 to $250,000 (based on experience) plus competitive benefits.
